content.description: Climb a crimpy crux to a powerful overhang.
content.location: It is the 5th route from the left on the main face.

content.description:
Begin with a thin, hard start, then traverse 6’ left and straight up connecting to

Big Bird’s

seventh bolt.
content.location:
Do the same start as for

Sesame Boulevard

and

Big Bird Gesus

.

content.description: Follow the grey streak. Stick clip the first high bolt.
content.location: It is the far left route on the main face.

content.description:
Start as for

Big Bird Gesus

, then keeps traversing left pass

Rosita

,

Abracadabra

, and finally join

Oscar the Grouch

. This is an awesome link-up. It is a long pitch that climbs the best second half of

Oscar the Grouch

. Use a long runner when you join

Oscar the Grouch

.
content.location: It is the 8th route from the left on the main face.

content.description: Climb a bouldery sequence for the first 3 bolts, then go up and slightly left, through a cruxy overhang to final vertical rock. Bring a runner for the 9th bolt.
content.location: It is the 6th route from the left on the main face.

content.description: Climb a hard crux to a power endurance route with a bad rest on a scoop.
content.location: It is the 4th route from the left on the main face.

content.description: Murray Monster has a crimpy crux to a big move. There are nice pockets before the anchor.
content.location: It is on the far right side of opposite side of the main wall.

content.description: This has big bouldery moves up the overhanging wall and is steep, pumpy, and lots of fun. Milk the rests between the cruxes. There is a tricky crux in the lower third of the route with a tough clip on the extended draw. The extended draw is made of rope and probably needs replacing with some chain.
content.protection: 8 bolts. There is a fixed anchor at the top with a stainless steel carabiner.  The 4th bolt is dually used as an extended perma-draw and hanger for a normal quick draw.
content.location: It is the first route (from left to right) on the cave wall (the backside of main wall).

content.description:
This is mossy and long on a positive face. It is located just around the corner to the right from

Big Bird

.
content.location:
This is the route to the right around the corner from

Big Bird

.

content.description: A choss pile. It is kind of runout, because the rock is too hollow for bolts. It climbs fun though.
content.location: It is the first route on the left side of the opposite side of the main wall.

content.description:
Start right of

Mr. Snuffleupagus

. It goes through the left side of a car-size flake up high.
content.location: It is the 3rd route from left to right on opposite side of the main wall.

content.description: Grover's Muppet Adventure is just to the right of the log laying against the wall. There are big, nice holds.
content.location: It is the left route on 5.10s wall.

content.description: Climb the seam/crack to a big “chossy looking” bulge to a second cruxy bulge (with long fixed chain draw).
content.location: It is the 7th route from the left on the main face.

content.description: This route has big holds and is in the middle of the face.
content.location: The route is in the middle of the 5.10s Wall.

content.description: The Count is a short route on the big boulder in between the two giant boulders. Climb big holds on slightly overhanging rock.
content.location: It is the left route on a small boulder.

climbs.name: Cooperation
climbs.fa: Scotty Michels (highball), Patricio Vyhmeister (as a sport route by mistake)

content.description: Sit start, and boulder the steep right side of the west side of the boulder. This was first highballed by Scotty Nichols. I did not know it was a boulder problem already! We kept its original name and, in consensus with Scotty and other climbers, decided to leave the bolts.
content.location: It is on the right side of a small boulder.

content.description: Cookie Monster is an isolated route located in the east side of the second large boulder. It is bouldery, short, and steep. Bring a longer quickdraw for the 5th bolt.
content.location: It is a lonely route on the east side of second large boulder.

content.description:
Do a boulder problem start, climb for four bolts, and connect left to

Gesus's

fourth bolt. Finish up on

Gesus

.
content.location: It is the 8th route from the left on the main face.

content.description:
This adds a direct bouldery start to the good

Big Bird

. Climb for three bolts, and connect to

Big Bird’s

fourth bolt.
content.location:
Use the same start as for

Sesame Boulevard

,

Big Bird Gesus

, and

Two Headed Monster

.

content.description: Bert is a nice route with lots of buckets. It climbs the right side of the wall.
content.location: It is on the right side of the 5.10s wall.

climbs.name: Big Bird
climbs.fa: Paul Emrick, Jim Hurst, Scotty Michels, 2003? FA: Wylder Wilson

content.description: Big Bird was the first route bolted on the face, pumpy and powerful on great rock. Start in the right side of the wall and go up and slightly left. It was rebolted with stainless steel glue-ins in 2016.
content.location: This route is on the far right side of the main wall.
